organic_results.title: Acquisition Achievement Motive Among Mentally Retarded Boys
organic_results.snippet: Strength of achievement motivation and socialization of the achievement motive were examined with respect to 38 educable mentally retarded boys. While achievement motive is weaker among retarded boys than among boys of normal intelligence, socialization practices conducive to strong achievement motivation are similar for both groups. An inconsistency obtained, however, regarding social class position; among retarded boys, those from working class families evidenced higher achievement motive than those from …

publication_info.summary: S Jacobs - Sociology of Education, 1972 - JSTOR
